      34             : 
      35             : /**
      36             :  * An nsStyleContext represents the computed style data for an element.
      37             :  * The computed style data are stored in a set of structs (see
      38             :  * nsStyleStruct.h) that are cached either on the style context or in
      39             :  * the rule tree (see nsRuleNode.h for a description of this caching and
      40             :  * how the cached structs are shared).
      41             :  *
      42             :  * Since the data in |nsIStyleRule|s and |nsRuleNode|s are immutable
      43             :  * (with a few exceptions, like system color changes), the data in an
      44             :  * nsStyleContext are also immutable (with the additional exception of
      45             :  * GetUniqueStyleData).  When style data change,
      46             :  * ElementRestyler::Restyle creates a new style context.
      47             :  *
      48             :  * Style contexts are reference counted.  References are generally held
      49             :  * by:
      50             :  *  1. the |nsIFrame|s that are using the style context and
      51             :  *  2. any *child* style contexts (this might be the reverse of
      52             :  *     expectation, but it makes sense in this case)
      53             :  */
      54             : 
      55             : class nsStyleContext final
      56             : {
      57             : public:
      58             :   /**
      59             :    * Create a new style context.
      60             :    * @param aParent  The parent of a style context is used for CSS
      61             :    *                 inheritance.  When the element or pseudo-element
      62             :    *                 this style context represents the style data of
      63             :    *                 inherits a CSS property, the value comes from the
      64             :    *                 parent style context.  This means style context
      65             :    *                 parentage must match the definitions of inheritance
      66             :    *                 in the CSS specification.
      67             :    * @param aPseudoTag  The pseudo-element or anonymous box for which
      68             :    *                    this style context represents style.  Null if
      69             :    *                    this style context is for a normal DOM element.
      70             :    * @param aPseudoType  Must match aPseudoTag.
      71             :    * @param aRuleNode  A rule node representing the ordered sequence of
      72             :    *                   rules that any element, pseudo-element, or
      73             :    *                   anonymous box that this style context is for
      74             :    *                   matches.  See |nsRuleNode| and |nsIStyleRule|.
      75             :    * @param aSkipParentDisplayBasedStyleFixup
      76             :    *                 If set, this flag indicates that we should skip
      77             :    *                 the chunk of ApplyStyleFixups() that applies to
      78             :    *                 special cases where a child element's style may
      79             :    *                 need to be modified based on its parent's display
      80             :    *                 value.
      81             :    */
      82             :   nsStyleContext(nsStyleContext* aParent, nsIAtom* aPseudoTag,
      83             :                  mozilla::CSSPseudoElementType aPseudoType,
      84             :                  already_AddRefed<nsRuleNode> aRuleNode,
      85             :                  bool aSkipParentDisplayBasedStyleFixup);

     333             :   /*
     334             :    * Get the style data for a style struct.  This is the most important
     335             :    * member function of nsStyleContext.  It fills in a const pointer
     336             :    * to a style data struct that is appropriate for the style context's
     337             :    * frame.  This struct may be shared with other contexts (either in
     338             :    * the rule tree or the style context tree), so it should not be
     339             :    * modified.
     340             :    *
     341             :    * This function will NOT return null (even when out of memory) when
     342             :    * given a valid style struct ID, so the result does not need to be
     343             :    * null-checked.
     344             :    *
     345             :    * The typesafe functions below are preferred to the use of this
     346             :    * function, both because they're easier to read and because they're
     347             :    * faster.
     348             :    */
     349             :   const void* NS_FASTCALL StyleData(nsStyleStructID aSID);

     397             :   /**
     398             :    * Compute the style changes needed during restyling when this style
     399             :    * context is being replaced by aNewContext.  (This is nonsymmetric since
     400             :    * we optimize by skipping comparison for styles that have never been
     401             :    * requested.)
     402             :    *
     403             :    * This method returns a change hint (see nsChangeHint.h).  All change
     404             :    * hints apply to the frame and its later continuations or ib-split
     405             :    * siblings.  Most (all of those except the "NotHandledForDescendants"
     406             :    * hints) also apply to all descendants.
     407             :    *

     409             :    * representing which structs were compared to be non-equal.

     470             :    * many conditions that make it safe to call.
     471             :    */
     472             :   void MoveTo(nsStyleContext* aNewParent);
     473             : 
     474             :   /**
     475             :    * Swaps owned style struct pointers between this and aNewContext, on
     476             :    * the assumption that aNewContext is the new style context for a frame
     477             :    * and this is the old one.  aStructs indicates which structs to consider
     478             :    * swapping; only those which are owned in both this and aNewContext
     479             :    * will be swapped.
     480             :    *
     481             :    * Additionally, if there are identical struct pointers for one of the
     482             :    * structs indicated by aStructs, and it is not an owned struct on this,
     483             :    * then the cached struct slot on this will be set to null.  If the struct
     484             :    * has been swapped on an ancestor, this style context (being the old one)
     485             :    * will be left caching the struct pointer on the new ancestor, despite
     486             :    * inheriting from the old ancestor.  This is not normally a problem, as
     487             :    * this style context will usually be destroyed by being released at the
     488             :    * end of ElementRestyler::Restyle; but for style contexts held on to outside
     489             :    * of the frame, we need to clear out the cached pointer so that if we need
     490             :    * it again we'll re-fetch it from the new ancestor.
     491             :    */
     492             :   void SwapStyleData(nsStyleContext* aNewContext, uint32_t aStructs);
     493             : 
     494             :   /**
     495             :    * On each descendant of this style context, clears out any cached inherited
     496             :    * structs indicated in aStructs.
     497             :    */
     498             :   void ClearCachedInheritedStyleDataOnDescendants(uint32_t aStructs);
     499             : 
     500             :   /**
     501             :    * Sets the NS_STYLE_INELIGIBLE_FOR_SHARING bit on this style context
     502             :    * and its descendants.  If it finds a descendant that has the bit
     503             :    * already set, assumes that it can skip that subtree.

     607             :   // Helper functions for GetStyle* and PeekStyle*
     608             :   #define STYLE_STRUCT_INHERITED(name_, checkdata_cb_)                  \
     609             :     template<bool aComputeData>                                         \
     610             :     const nsStyle##name_ * DoGetStyle##name_() {                        \
     611             :       if (mSource.IsGeckoRuleNode()) {                                  \
     612             :         const nsStyle##name_ * cachedData =                             \
     613             :           static_cast<nsStyle##name_*>(                                 \
     614             :             mCachedInheritedData.mStyleStructs[eStyleStruct_##name_]);  \
     615             :         if (cachedData) /* Have it cached already, yay */               \
     616             :           return cachedData;                                            \
     617             :         if (!aComputeData) {                                            \
     618             :           /* We always cache inherited structs on the context when we */\
     619             :           /* compute them. */                                           \
     620             :           return nullptr;                                               \
     621             :         }                                                               \
     622             :         /* Have the rulenode deal */                                    \
     623             :         AUTO_CHECK_DEPENDENCY(eStyleStruct_##name_);                    \
     624             :         const nsStyle##name_ * newData =                                \
     625             :           mSource.AsGeckoRuleNode()->                                   \
     626             :             GetStyle##name_<aComputeData>(this, mBits);                 \
     627             :         /* always cache inherited data on the style context; the rule */\
     628             :         /* node set the bit in mBits for us if needed. */               \
     629             :         mCachedInheritedData.mStyleStructs[eStyleStruct_##name_] =      \
     630             :           const_cast<nsStyle##name_ *>(newData);                        \
     631             :         return newData;                                                 \
     632             :       }                                                                 \
     633             :       /**                                                               \
     634             :        * Always forward to the parent to grab the inherited style struct\
     635             :        * we're a text node.                                             \
     636             :        *                                                                \
     637             :        * This causes the parent element's style context to cache any    \
     638             :        * inherited structs we request for a text node, which means we   \
     639             :        * don't have to compute change hints for the text node, as       \
     640             :        * handling the change on the parent element is sufficient.       \
     641             :        *                                                                \
     642             :        * Note that adding the inherit bit is ok, because the struct     \
     643             :        * pointer returned by the parent and the child is owned by       \
     644             :        * Servo. This is fine if the pointers are the same (as it        \
     645             :        * should, read below), because both style context sources will   \
     646             :        * hold it.                                                       \
     647             :        *                                                                \
     648             :        * In the case of a mishandled frame, we could end up with the    \
     649             :        * pointer to and old parent style, but that's fine too, since    \
     650             :        * the parent style context will remain alive until we reframe,   \
     651             :        * in which case we'll discard both style contexts. Also, we      \
     652             :        * hold a strong reference to the parent style context, which     \
     653             :        * makes it a non-issue.                                          \
     654             :        *                                                                \
     655             :        * Also, note that the assertion below should be true, except     \
     656             :        * for those frames we still don't handle correctly, like         \
     657             :        * anonymous table wrappers, in which case the pointers will      \
     658             :        * differ.                                                        \
     659             :        *                                                                \
     660             :        * That means we're not going to restyle correctly text frames    \
     661             :        * of anonymous table wrappers, for example. It's kind of         \
     662             :        * embarrassing, but I think it's not worth it to add more        \
     663             :        * logic here unconditionally, given that's going to be fixed.    \
     664             :        *                                                                \
     665             :        * TODO(emilio): Convert to a strong assertion once we support    \
     666             :        * all kinds of random frames. In fact, this can be a great       \
     667             :        * assertion to debug them.                                       \
     668             :        */                                                               \
     669             :       if (mPseudoTag == nsCSSAnonBoxes::mozText) {                      \
     670             :         MOZ_ASSERT(mParent);                                            \
     671             :         const nsStyle##name_* data =                                    \
     672             :           mParent->DoGetStyle##name_<aComputeData>();                   \
     673             :         NS_WARNING_ASSERTION(!data ||                                   \
     674             :           data == Servo_GetStyle##name_(mSource.AsServoComputedValues()), \
     675             :           "bad data");                                                  \
     676             :         return data;                                                    \
     677             :       }                                                                 \
     678             :                                                                         \
     679             :       const bool needToCompute = !(mBits & NS_STYLE_INHERIT_BIT(name_));\
     680             :       if (!aComputeData && needToCompute) {                             \
     681             :         return nullptr;                                                 \
     682             :       }                                                                 \
     683             :                                                                         \
     684             :       const nsStyle##name_* data =                                      \
     685             :         Servo_GetStyle##name_(mSource.AsServoComputedValues());         \
     686             :       /* perform any remaining main thread work on the struct */        \
     687             :       if (needToCompute) {                                              \
     688             :         MOZ_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());                                  \
     689             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!mozilla::ServoStyleSet::IsInServoTraversal());      \
     690             :         const_cast<nsStyle##name_*>(data)->FinishStyle(PresContext());  \
     691             :         /* the Servo-backed StyleContextSource owns the struct */       \
     692             :         AddStyleBit(NS_STYLE_INHERIT_BIT(name_));                       \
     693             :       }                                                                 \
     694             :       return data;                                                      \
     695             :     }
     696             : 
     697             :   #define STYLE_STRUCT_RESET(name_, checkdata_cb_)                      \
     698             :     template<bool aComputeData>                                         \
     699             :     const nsStyle##name_ * DoGetStyle##name_() {                        \
     700             :       if (mSource.IsGeckoRuleNode()) {                                  \
     701             :         if (mCachedResetData) {                                         \
     702             :           const nsStyle##name_ * cachedData =                           \
     703             :             static_cast<nsStyle##name_*>(                               \

     705             :           if (cachedData) /* Have it cached already, yay */             \
     706             :             return cachedData;                                          \
     707             :         }                                                               \
     708             :         /* Have the rulenode deal */                                    \

     711             :           GetStyle##name_<aComputeData>(this);                          \
     712             :       }                                                                 \
     713             :       const bool needToCompute = !(mBits & NS_STYLE_INHERIT_BIT(name_));\
     714             :       if (!aComputeData && needToCompute) {                             \
     715             :         return nullptr;                                                 \
     716             :       }                                                                 \

     748             :   RefPtr<nsStyleContext> mParent;
     749             : 
     750             :   // Children are kept in two circularly-linked lists.  The list anchor
     751             :   // is not part of the list (null for empty), and we point to the first
     752             :   // child.
     753             :   // mEmptyChild for children whose rule node is the root rule node, and
     754             :   // mChild for other children.  The order of children is not
     755             :   // meaningful.
     756             :   nsStyleContext* mChild;

     758             :   nsStyleContext* mPrevSibling;

     761             :   // Style to be used instead for the R, G, and B components of color,
     762             :   // background-color, and border-*-color if the nearest ancestor link
     763             :   // element is visited (see RelevantLinkVisited()).

     765             : 
     766             :   // If this style context is for a pseudo-element or anonymous box,
     767             :   // the relevant atom.
     768             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIAtom> mPseudoTag;
     769             : 
     770             :   // The source for our style data, either a Gecko nsRuleNode or a Servo
     771             :   // ComputedValues struct. This never changes after construction, except
     772             :   // when it's released and nulled out during teardown.
     773             :   const mozilla::OwningStyleContextSource mSource;
     774             : 
     775             : #ifdef MOZ_STYLO
     776             :   // In Gecko, we can get this off the rule node. We make this conditional
     777             :   // on stylo builds to avoid the memory bloat on release.
     778             :   nsPresContext* mPresContext;
     779             : #endif
     780             : 
     781             :   // mCachedInheritedData and mCachedResetData point to both structs that
     782             :   // are owned by this style context and structs that are owned by one of
     783             :   // this style context's ancestors (which are indirectly owned since this
     784             :   // style context owns a reference to its parent).  If the bit in |mBits|
     785             :   // is set for a struct, that means that the pointer for that struct is
     786             :   // owned by an ancestor or by the rule node rather than by this style context.
     787             :   // Since style contexts typically have some inherited data but only sometimes
     788             :   // have reset data, we always allocate the mCachedInheritedData, but only
     789             :   // sometimes allocate the mCachedResetData.
     790             :   nsResetStyleData*       mCachedResetData; // Cached reset style data.
     791             :   nsInheritedStyleData    mCachedInheritedData; // Cached inherited style data
     792             : 
     793             :   // mBits stores a number of things:
     794             :   //  - It records (using the style struct bits) which structs are
     795             :   //    inherited from the parent context or owned by the rule node (i.e.,
     796             :   //    not owned by the style context).
     797             :   //  - It also stores the additional bits listed at the top of
     798             :   //    nsStyleStruct.h.
     799             :   uint64_t                mBits;
     800             :
